Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient reports feeling good and has shared ideas in meetings, indicating a desire to be more outgoing.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has experienced nervousness before speaking up but felt relieved and proud afterward. They are trying to prepare more and remind themselves of the validity of their ideas. They have also had positive discussions with their sister, focusing on healthier communication.
Mental Health Observations: The patient feels closer to their sister and is building confidence in sharing ideas.
Progress Evaluation: The patient has shown progress in speaking up in meetings and developing healthier relationships.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient plans to set small goals, like introducing themselves to new people, to help with their hesitance in social situations.
Next Steps: The patient feels positive about trying small steps to connect with others and is looking forward to discussing their experiences in the next session.
